name: ionoscloud
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing ionoscloud cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`ionoscloud` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/ionos-cloud/terraform-provider-ionoscloud).

endpoint.description: IonosCloud REST API URL. Usually not necessary to be set, SDKs know internally how to route requests to the API.

password.description: IonosCloud password for API operations. If token is provided, token is preferred

retries.deprecationMessage: Timeout is used instead of this functionality

s3AccessKey.description: Access key for IONOS Object Storage operations.

s3Region.description: Region for IONOS Object Storage operations.

s3SecretKey.description: Secret key for IONOS Object Storage operations.

token.description: IonosCloud bearer token for API operations.

username.description: IonosCloud username for API operations. If token is provided, token is preferred

maxCores.description: The maximum number of cores available

maxRam.description: The maximum number of RAM in MB

action.description: Specifies the action to be taken when the rule is matched. Possible values: ACCEPTED, REJECTED, ALL. Immutable, update forces re-creation.

bucket.description: Specifies the IONOS Object Storage bucket where the flow log data will be stored. The bucket must exist. Immutable, update forces re-creation.

direction.description: Specifies the traffic direction pattern. Valid values: INGRESS, EGRESS, BIDIRECTIONAL. Immutable, update forces re-creation.

id.description: The ID of the NIC.

name.description:
Specifies the name of the flow log.

⚠️ **Note:**: Removing the `flowlog` forces re-creation of the NIC resource.

dhcpv6.description: Indicates whether this NIC receives an IPv6 address through DHCP.

firewalls.description: Allows to define firewall rules inline in the server. See the Firewall section.

ips.description: Collection of IP addresses assigned to a nic. Explicitly assigned public IPs need to come from reserved IP blocks, Passing value null or empty array will assign an IP address automatically.

ipv6CidrBlock.description: IPv6 CIDR block assigned to the NIC.

ipv6Ips.description: Collection for IPv6 addresses assigned to a nic. Explicitly assigned IPv6 addresses need to come from inside the IPv6 CIDR block assigned to the nic.

name.description: [string] The name of the server.
[string] The name of the server.

type.description: (Computed)[string] Server usages: [ENTERPRISE](https://docs.ionos.com/cloud/compute-engine/virtual-servers/virtual-servers) or [CUBE](https://docs.ionos.com/cloud/compute-engine/virtual-servers/cloud-cubes). This property is immutable.

availabilityZone.description: [string] The availability zone in which the server should exist. E.g: `AUTO`, `ZONE_1`, `ZONE_2`. This property is immutable.

backupUnitId.description: The uuid of the Backup Unit that user has access to. The property is immutable and is only allowed to be set on a new volume creation. It is mandatory to provide either 'public image' or 'imageAlias' in conjunction with this property.

bootServer.description: The UUID of the attached server.

imagePassword.deprecationMessage: Please use image_password under server level

licenceType.description: [string] Sets the OS type of the server.

name.description: [string] The name of the server.

size.description: The size of the volume in GB.

sshKeyPaths.description: [list] List of absolute paths to files containing a public SSH key that will be injected into IonosCloud provided Linux images.  Also accepts ssh keys directly. Required for IonosCloud Linux images. Required if `image_password` is not provided. Does not support `~` expansion to homedir in the given path. This property is immutable.
sshKeyPaths.deprecationMessage: Please use ssh_key_path under server level

sshKeys.description: [list] Immutable List of absolute or relative paths to files containing public SSH key that will be injected into IonosCloud provided Linux images. Also accepts ssh keys directly. Public SSH keys are set on the image as authorized keys for appropriate SSH login to the instance using the corresponding private key. This field may only be set in creation requests. When reading, it always returns null. SSH keys are only supported if a public Linux image is used for the volume creation. Does not support `~` expansion to homedir in the given path.
sshKeys.deprecationMessage: Please use ssh_keys under server level

userData.description: The cloud-init configuration for the volume as base64 encoded string. The property is immutable and is only allowed to be set on a new volume creation. It is mandatory to provide either 'public image' or 'imageAlias' that has cloud-init compatibility in conjunction with this property.

name.description: [string] The domain name. Externally reachable.

port.description: [int] The port of the upstream. Default value: `80`.

scheme.description: [string] The target URL of the upstream. Default value: `http`.

weight.description: [int] Weight with which to split traffic to the upstream. Default value: `100`.

action.description: [string] Specifies the action to be taken when the rule is matched. Possible values: ACCEPTED, REJECTED, ALL. Immutable, forces re-creation.

bucket.description: [string] Specifies the IONOS Object Storage bucket where the flow log data will be stored. The bucket must exist. Immutable, forces re-creation.

direction.description: [string] Specifies the traffic direction pattern. Valid values: INGRESS, EGRESS, BIDIRECTIONAL. Immutable, forces re-creation.

id.description: The resource's unique identifier.

name.description:
[string] Specifies the name of the flow log.

⚠️ **Note:**: Removing the `flowlog` forces re-creation of the application load balancer resource.

conditions.description: [list] - An array of items in the collection.The action is only performed if each and every condition is met; if no conditions are set, the rule will always be performed.

dropQuery.description: [bool] Default is false; valid only for REDIRECT actions.

location.description: [string] The location for redirecting; mandatory and valid only for REDIRECT actions.

name.description: [string] The unique name of the Application Load Balancer HTTP rule.

responseMessage.description: [string] The response message of the request; mandatory for STATIC action.

statusCode.description: [int] Valid only for REDIRECT and STATIC actions. For REDIRECT actions, default is 301 and possible values are 301, 302, 303, 307, and 308. For STATIC actions, default is 503 and valid range is 200 to 599.

targetGroup.description: [string] The UUID of the target group; mandatory for FORWARD action.

type.description: [string] Type of the Http Rule.

condition.description: [string] Matching rule for the HTTP rule condition attribute; mandatory for HEADER, PATH, QUERY, METHOD, HOST, and COOKIE types; must be null when type is SOURCE_IP.

key.description: [string] Must be null when type is PATH, METHOD, HOST, or SOURCE_IP. Key can only be set when type is COOKIES, HEADER, or QUERY.

negate.description: [bool] Specifies whether the condition is negated or not; the default is False.

type.description: [string] Type of the Http Rule condition.

value.description: [string] Mandatory for conditions CONTAINS, EQUALS, MATCHES, STARTS_WITH, ENDS_WITH; must be null when condition is EXISTS; should be a valid CIDR if provided and if type is SOURCE_IP.

keyId.description: The key ID of the external account binding

keySecret.description: The secret of the external account binding

metric.description: [string] The Metric that should trigger the scaling actions. Metric values are checked at fixed intervals. Possible values: `INSTANCE_CPU_UTILIZATION_AVERAGE`, `INSTANCE_NETWORK_IN_BYTES`, `INSTANCE_NETWORK_IN_PACKETS`, `INSTANCE_NETWORK_OUT_BYTES`, `INSTANCE_NETWORK_OUT_PACKETS`

range.description: [string] Defines the time range, for which the samples will be aggregated. Default is 120s. *Note that when you set it to values like 5m the API will automatically transform it in PT5M, so the plan will show you a diff in state that should be ignored.*

scaleInAction.description: [list] Specifies the action to take when the `scaleInThreshold` is exceeded. Hereby, scaling in is always about removing VMs that are currently associated with this autoscaling group. Default termination policy is OLDEST_SERVER_FIRST.

scaleInThreshold.description: [int] A lower threshold on the value of `metric`. Will be used with `less than` (<) operator. Exceeding this will start a Scale-In Action as specified by the `scaleInAction` property. The value must have a higher minimum delta to the `scaleOutThreshold` depending on the `metric` to avoid competitive actions at the same time.

scaleOutAction.description: [list] Specifies the action to take when the `scaleOutThreshold` is exceeded. Hereby, scaling out is always about adding new VMs to this autoscaling group.

scaleOutThreshold.description: [int] The upper threshold for the value of the `metric`. Used with the `greater than` (>) operator. A scale-out action is triggered when this value is exceeded, specified by the `scaleOutAction` property. The value must have a lower minimum delta to the `scaleInThreshold`, depending on the metric, to avoid competing for actions simultaneously. If `properties.policy.unit=TOTAL`, a value >= 40 must be chosen.

unit.description: [string] Units of the applied Metric. Possible values are: `PER_HOUR`, `PER_MINUTE`, `PER_SECOND`, `TOTAL`.

amount.description: [int] When `amountType == ABSOLUTE`, this is the number of VMs removed in one step. When `amountType == PERCENTAGE`, this is a percentage value, which will be applied to the autoscaling group's current `targetReplicaCount` in order to derive the number of VMs that will be removed in one step. There will always be at least one VM removed. For SCALE_IN operation new volumes are NOT deleted after the server deletion.

amountType.description: [string] The type for the given amount. Possible values are: `ABSOLUTE`, `PERCENTAGE`.

cooldownPeriod.description: [string] Minimum time to pass after this Scaling action has started, until the next Scaling action will be started. Additionally, if a Scaling action is currently in progress, no second Scaling action will be started for the same autoscaling group. Instead, the Metric will be re-evaluated after the current Scaling action is completed (either successfully or with failures). This is validated with a minimum value of 2 minutes and a maximum of 24 hours currently. Default value is 5 minutes if not given. *Note that when you set it to values like 5m the API will automatically transform it in PT5M, so the plan will show you a diff in state that should be ignored.*

deleteVolumes.description: [bool] If set to `true`, when deleting a replica during scale in, any attached volume will also be deleted. When set to `false`, all volumes remain in the datacenter and must be deleted manually. Note that every scale-out creates new volumes. When they are not deleted, they will eventually use all of your contracts resource limits. At this point, scaling out would not be possible anymore.

terminationPolicyType.description: [string] The type of the termination policy for the autoscaling group so that a specific pattern is followed for Scaling-In replicas. Default termination policy is `OLDEST_SERVER_FIRST`. Possible values are: `OLDEST_SERVER_FIRST`, `NEWEST_SERVER_FIRST`, `RANDOM`

amount.description: [int] When `amountType=ABSOLUTE` specifies the absolute number of VMs that are added. The value must be between 1 to 10. `amountType=PERCENTAGE` specifies the percentage value that is applied to the current number of replicas of the VM Auto Scaling Group. The value must be between 1 to 200. At least one VM is always added.

amountType.description: [string] The type for the given amount. Possible values are: `ABSOLUTE`, `PERCENTAGE`.

cooldownPeriod.description: [string] Minimum time to pass after this Scaling action has started, until the next Scaling action will be started. Additionally, if a Scaling action is currently in progress, no second Scaling action will be started for the same autoscaling group. Instead, the Metric will be re-evaluated after the current Scaling action is completed (either successfully or with failures). This is validated with a minimum value of 2 minutes and a maximum of 24 hours currently. Default value is 5 minutes if not given. *Note that when you set it to values like 5m the API will automatically transform it in PT5M, so the plan will show you a diff in state that should be ignored.*

availabilityZone.description: [string] The zone where the VMs are created using this configuration. Possible values are: `AUTO`, `ZONE_1`, `ZONE_2`.

cores.description: [int] The total number of cores for the VMs.

cpuFamily.description: [string] PU family for the VMs created using this configuration. If null, the VM will be created with the default CPU family for the assigned location. Possible values are: `INTEL_SKYLAKE`, `INTEL_XEON`.

nics.description: Set of NICs associated with this Replica.

ram.description: [int] The amount of memory for the VMs in MB, e.g. 2048. Size must be specified in multiples of 256 MB with a minimum of 256 MB; however, if you set ramHotPlug to TRUE then you must use a minimum of 1024 MB. If you set the RAM size more than 240GB, then ramHotPlug will be set to FALSE and can not be set to TRUE unless RAM size not set to less than 240GB.

volumes.description: [list] List of volumes associated with this Replica.

dhcp.description: Dhcp flag for this replica Nic. This is an optional attribute with default value of 'true' if not given in the request payload or given as null.

firewallActive.description: Activate or deactivate the firewall. By default, an active firewall without any defined rules will block all incoming network traffic except for the firewall rules that explicitly allows certain protocols, IP addresses and ports.

firewallRules.description: List of all firewall rules for the specified NIC.

firewallType.description: The type of firewall rules that will be allowed on the NIC. If not specified, the default INGRESS value is used.

flowLogs.description: List of all flow logs for the specified NIC.

lan.description: Lan ID for this replica Nic.

name.description: [string] User-defined name for the Autoscaling Group.

targetGroup.description: In order to link VM to ALB, target group must be provided.

icmpCode.description: Sets the allowed code (from 0 to 254) when ICMP protocol is selected. The value 'null' allows all codes.

icmpType.description: Sets the allowed type (from 0 to 254) if the protocol ICMP is selected. The value 'null' allows all types.

name.description: [string] User-defined name for the Autoscaling Group.

portRangeEnd.description: Sets the end range of the allowed port (from 1 to 65535) if the protocol TCP or UDP is selected. The value 'null' for 'port_range_start' and 'port_range_end' allows all ports.

portRangeStart.description: Sets the initial range of the allowed port (from 1 to 65535) if the protocol TCP or UDP is selected. The value 'null' for 'port_range_start' and 'port_range_end' allows all ports.

protocol.description: The protocol for the rule. The property cannot be modified after its creation (not allowed in update requests).

sourceIp.description: Only traffic originating from the respective IPv4 address is permitted. The value 'null' allows traffic from any IP address.

sourceMac.description: Only traffic originating from the respective MAC address is permitted. Valid format: 'aa:bb:cc:dd:ee:ff'. The value 'null' allows traffic from any MAC address.

targetIp.description: If the target NIC has multiple IP addresses, only the traffic directed to the respective IP address of the NIC is allowed. The value 'null' allows traffic to any target IP address.

type.description: The firewall rule type. If not specified, the default value 'INGRESS' is used.

action.description: Specifies the traffic direction pattern. Valid values: ACCEPTED, REJECTED, ALL. Immutable, forces re-recreation of the nic resource.

bucket.description: The bucket name of an existing IONOS Object Storage bucket. Immutable, forces re-recreation of the nic resource.

direction.description: Specifies the traffic direction pattern. Valid values: INGRESS, EGRESS, BIDIRECTIONAL. Immutable, forces re-recreation of the nic resource.

id.description: The resource's unique identifier.

name.description: [string] User-defined name for the Autoscaling Group.

port.description: The port for the target group.

targetGroupId.description: The ID of the target group.

weight.description: The weight for the target group.

backupUnitId.description: [string] The uuid of the Backup Unit that user has access to. The property is immutable and is only allowed to be set on a new volume creation. It is mandatory to provide either `public image` or `imageAlias` in conjunction with this property.

bootOrder.description:
[string] Determines whether the volume will be used as a boot volume. Set to NONE, the volume will not be used as boot volume. Set to PRIMARY, the volume will be used as boot volume and set to AUTO will delegate the decision to the provisioning engine to decide whether to use the volume as boot volume.
Notice that exactly one volume can be set to PRIMARY or all of them set to AUTO.

bus.description: [string] The bus type of the volume. Default setting is `VIRTIO`. The bus type `IDE` is also supported.

image.description: [string] The image installed on the volume. Only the UUID of the image is presently supported.

imageAlias.description: [string] The image installed on the volume. Must be an `imageAlias` as specified via the images API. Note that one of `image` or `imageAlias` must be set, but not both.

imagePassword.description: [string] Image password for this replica volume.

name.description: [string] Name for this replica volume.

size.description: [int] Name for this replica volume.

sshKeys.description: List of ssh keys, supports values or paths to files. Cannot be changed at update.

type.description: [string] Storage Type for this replica volume. Possible values: `SSD`, `HDD`, `SSD_STANDARD` or `SSD_PREMIUM`.

userData.description: [string] User-data (Cloud Init) for this replica volume. Make sure you provide a Cloud Init compatible image in conjunction with this parameter.

prefix.description: [string] The prefix of the routing rule.

scheme.description: [string] The scheme of the routing rule.

upstream.description: [map] - A map of properties for the rule

caching.description: [bool] Enable or disable caching. If enabled, the CDN will cache the responses from the upstream host. Subsequent requests for the same resource will be served from the cache.

host.description: [string] The upstream host that handles the requests if not already cached. This host will be protected by the WAF if the option is enabled.

rateLimitClass.description: [string] Rate limit class that will be applied to limit the number of incoming requests per IP.

sniMode.description: [string] The SNI (Server Name Indication) mode of the upstream. It supports two modes: 1) `distribution`: for outgoing connections to the upstream host, the CDN requires the upstream host to present a valid certificate that matches the configured domain of the CDN distribution; 2) `origin`: for outgoing connections to the upstream host, the CDN requires the upstream host to present a valid certificate that matches the configured upstream/origin hostname.

waf.description: [bool] Enable or disable WAF to protect the upstream host.

vulnerabilityScanning.description:
[bool] Enables or disables the Vulnerability Scanning feature for the Container Registry. To disable this feature, set the attribute to false when creating the CR resource.

> **⚠ WARNING** `Container Registry Vulnerability Scanning` is a paid feature which is enabled by default, and cannot be turned off after activation. To disable this feature for a Container Registry, ensure `vulnerability_scanning` is set to false on resource creation.

dhcp.description: [bool] Indicates if the Kubernetes node pool LAN will reserve an IP using DHCP. The default value is 'true'.

routes.description: [list] An array of additional LANs attached to worker nodes.

network.description: [string] IPv4 or IPv6 CIDR to be routed via the interface.

dayOfTheWeek.description: [string] Must be set with one the values `Monday`, `Tuesday`, `Wednesday`, `Thursday`, `Friday`, `Saturday` or `Sunday`.

time.description: [string] Time at which the maintenance should start. Must conform to the 'HH:MM:SS' 24-hour format. This pattern matches the "HH:MM:SS 24-hour format with leading 0" format. For more information take a look at [this link](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/7536755/regular-expression-for-matching-hhmm-time-format).

brokerAddresses.description:
[list] IP addresses and subnet of cluster brokers. **Note** the following
unavailable IP range: 10.224.0.0/11

datacenterId.description: [string] The datacenter to connect your instance to.

lanId.description: [string] The numeric LAN ID to connect your instance to.

destinations.description: [list] The configuration of the logs datastore, a list that contains elements with the following structure:

protocol.description: [string] "Protocol to use as intake. Possible values are: http, tcp."

source.description: [string] The source parser to be used.

tag.description: [string] The tag is used to distinguish different pipelines. Must be unique amongst the pipeline's array items.

retentionInDays.description: [int] Defines the number of days a log record should be kept in loki. Works with loki destination type only. Can be one of: 7, 14, 30.

type.description: [string] The internal output stream to send logs to.

gatewayIps.description: [list] Collection of gateway IP addresses of the NAT gateway. Will be auto-generated if not provided. Should ideally be an IP belonging to the same subnet as the LAN.

id.description: [int] Id for the LAN connected to the NAT gateway.

end.description: [int] Target port range end associated with the NAT gateway rule.

start.description: [int] Target port range start associated with the NAT gateway rule.

action.description: [string] Specifies the action to be taken when the rule is matched. Possible values: ACCEPTED, REJECTED, ALL. Immutable, forces re-creation.

bucket.description: [string] Specifies the IONOS Object Storage bucket where the flow log data will be stored. The bucket must exist. Immutable, forces re-creation.

direction.description: [string] Specifies the traffic direction pattern. Valid values: INGRESS, EGRESS, BIDIRECTIONAL. Immutable, forces re-creation.

id.description: The resource's unique identifier.

name.description:
[string] Specifies the name of the flow log.

⚠️ **Note:**: Removing the `flowlog` forces re-creation of the network load balancer resource.

clientTimeout.description: [int] ClientTimeout is expressed in milliseconds. This inactivity timeout applies when the client is expected to acknowledge or send data. If unset the default of 50 seconds will be used.

connectTimeout.description: [int] It specifies the maximum time (in milliseconds) to wait for a connection attempt to a target VM to succeed. If unset, the default of 5 seconds will be used.

retries.description: [int] Retries specifies the number of retries to perform on a target VM after a connection failure. If unset, the default value of 3 will be used.

targetTimeout.description: [int] TargetTimeout specifies the maximum inactivity time (in milliseconds) on the target VM side. If unset, the default of 50 seconds will be used.

healthCheck.description: Health check attributes for Network Load Balancer forwarding rule target.

ip.description: [string] IP of a balanced target VM.

conditions.description: An array of items in the collection.The action is only performed if each and every condition is met; if no conditions are set, the rule will always be performed.

dropQuery.description: Default is false; valid only for REDIRECT actions.

location.description: The location for redirecting; mandatory and valid only for REDIRECT actions.

name.description: Name of an existing application load balancer that you want to search for. Search by name is case-insensitive. The whole resource name is required if `partial_match` parameter is not set to true.

responseMessage.description: The response message of the request; mandatory for STATIC action.

statusCode.description: Valid only for REDIRECT and STATIC actions. For REDIRECT actions, default is 301 and possible values are 301, 302, 303, 307, and 308. For STATIC actions, default is 503 and valid range is 200 to 599.

targetGroup.description: The UUID of the target group; mandatory for FORWARD action.

type.description: Type of the Http Rule condition.

condition.description: Matching rule for the HTTP rule condition attribute; mandatory for HEADER, PATH, QUERY, METHOD, HOST, and COOKIE types; must be null when type is SOURCE_IP.

key.description: Must be null when type is PATH, METHOD, HOST, or SOURCE_IP. Key can only be set when type is COOKIES, HEADER, or QUERY.

negate.description: Specifies whether the condition is negated or not; the default is False.

type.description: Type of the Http Rule condition.

value.description: Mandatory for conditions CONTAINS, EQUALS, MATCHES, STARTS_WITH, ENDS_WITH; must be null when condition is EXISTS; should be a valid CIDR if provided and if type is SOURCE_IP.

keyId.description: The key ID of the external account binding

metric.description: The Metric that should trigger Scaling Actions. The values of the Metric are checked in fixed intervals.

range.description:
Defines the range of time from which samples will be aggregated. Default is 120s.
*Note that when you set it to values like 5m the API will automatically transform it in PT5M, so the plan will show you a diff in state that should be ignored.*

scaleInActions.description: Specifies the Action to take when the `scaleInThreshold`

scaleInThreshold.description: A lower threshold on the value of `metric`. Will be used with `less than` (<) operator. Exceeding this will start a Scale-In Action as specified by the `scaleInAction` property. The value must have a higher minimum delta to the `scaleOutThreshold` depending on the `metric` to avoid competitive actions at the same time.

scaleOutActions.description: Specifies the action to take when the `scaleOutThreshold` is exceeded. Hereby, scaling out is always about adding new VMs to this autoscaling group

scaleOutThreshold.description: The upper threshold for the value of the `metric`. Used with the `greater than` (>) operator. A scale-out action is triggered when this value is exceeded, specified by the `scaleOutAction` property. The value must have a lower minimum delta to the `scaleInThreshold`, depending on the metric, to avoid competing for actions simultaneously. If `properties.policy.unit=TOTAL`, a value >= 40 must be chosen.

unit.description: Specifies the Action to take when the `scaleInThreshold` is exceeded. Hereby, scaling in is always about removing VMs that are currently associated with this Autoscaling Group.

amount.description: When `amountType == ABSOLUTE`, this is the number of VMs added or removed in one step. When `amountType == PERCENTAGE`, this is a percentage value, which will be applied to the Autoscaling Group's current `targetReplicaCount` in order to derive the number of VMs that will be added or removed in one step. There will always be at least one VM added or removed.

amountType.description: The type for the given amount. Possible values are: [ABSOLUTE, PERCENTAGE].

cooldownPeriod.description:
Minimum time to pass after this Scaling Action has started, until the next Scaling Action will be started. Additionally, if a Scaling Action is currently in progress, no second Scaling Action will be started for the same Autoscaling Group. Instead, the Metric will be re-evaluated after the current Scaling Action completed (either successful or with failures).
*Note that when you set it to values like 5m the API will automatically transform it in PT5M, so the plan will show you a diff in state that should be ignored.*

deleteVolumes.description: If set to 'true', when deleting an replica during scale in, any attached volume will also be deleted. When set to 'false', all volumes remain in the datacenter and must be deleted manually. Note that every scale-out creates new volumes. When they are not deleted, they will eventually use all of your contracts resource limits. At this point, scaling out would not be possible anymore.

terminationPolicyType.description: The type of the termination policy for the autoscaling group so that a specific pattern is followed for Scaling-In instances. Default termination policy is OLDEST_SERVER_FIRST.

amount.description: When `amountType == ABSOLUTE`, this is the number of VMs added or removed in one step. When `amountType == PERCENTAGE`, this is a percentage value, which will be applied to the Autoscaling Group's current `targetReplicaCount` in order to derive the number of VMs that will be added or removed in one step. There will always be at least one VM added or removed.

amountType.description: The type for the given amount. Possible values are: [ABSOLUTE, PERCENTAGE].

cooldownPeriod.description:
Minimum time to pass after this Scaling Action has started, until the next Scaling Action will be started. Additionally, if a Scaling Action is currently in progress, no second Scaling Action will be started for the same Autoscaling Group. Instead, the Metric will be re-evaluated after the current Scaling Action completed (either successful or with failures).
*Note that when you set it to values like 5m the API will automatically transform it in PT5M, so the plan will show you a diff in state that should be ignored.*

ionoscloud:compute/backupUnit:BackupUnit.description:
## Import

A Backup Unit resource can be imported using its `resource id`, e.g.

```sh
$ pulumi import ionoscloud:compute/backupUnit:BackupUnit demo {backup_unit_uuid}
```

This can be helpful when you want to import backup units which you have already created manually or using other means, outside of terraform. Please note that you need to manually specify the password when first declaring the resource in terraform, as there is no way to retrieve the password from the Cloud API.

portRangeStart.description: [int] Defines the start range of the allowed port (from 1 to 65534) if protocol TCP or UDP is chosen. Leave portRangeStart and portRangeEnd null to allow all ports.

protocol.description: [string] The protocol for the rule: TCP, UDP, ICMP, ANY. Property cannot be modified after creation (disallowed in update requests).

sourceIp.description: [string] Only traffic originating from the respective IPv4 address is allowed. Value null allows all source IPs.

sourceMac.description: [string] Only traffic originating from the respective MAC address is allowed. Valid format: aa:bb:cc:dd:ee:ff. Value null allows all source MAC address. Valid format: aa:bb:cc:dd:ee:ff.

targetIp.description: [string] In case the target NIC has multiple IP addresses, only traffic directed to the respective IP address of the NIC is allowed. Value null allows all target IPs.

type.description: [string] The type of firewall rule. If is not specified, it will take the default value INGRESS.

ionoscloud:compute/nic:Nic.description:
## Import

Resource **Nic** can be imported using the `resource id`, e.g.

```sh
$ pulumi import ionoscloud:compute/nic:Nic mynic {datacenter uuid}/{server uuid}/{nic uuid}
```

datacenterId.description: [string] The ID of a Virtual Data Center.

deviceNumber.description: The Logical Unit Number (LUN) of the storage volume. Null if this NIC was created from CloudAPI and no DCD changes were done on the Datacenter.

dhcp.description: [Boolean] Indicates if the NIC should get an IP address using DHCP (true) or not (false).

dhcpv6.description: [Boolean] Indicates if the NIC should get an IPv6 address using DHCP (true) or not (false).

firewallActive.description: [Boolean] If this resource is set to true and is nested under a server resource firewall, with open SSH port, resource must be nested under the NIC.

firewallType.description: [String] The type of firewall rules that will be allowed on the NIC. If it is not specified it will take the default value INGRESS

flowlog.description: Only 1 flow log can be configured. Only the name field can change as part of an update. Flow logs holistically capture network information such as source and destination IP addresses, source and destination ports, number of packets, amount of bytes, the start and end time of the recording, and the type of protocol – and log the extent to which your instances are being accessed.

ips.description: [list] Collection of IP addresses assigned to a NIC. Explicitly assigned public IPs need to come from reserved IP blocks, Passing value null or empty array will assign an IP address automatically.

ipv6CidrBlock.description: Automatically assigned /80 IPv6 CIDR block if the NIC is connected to an IPv6 enabled LAN. You can also specify an /80 IPv6 CIDR block for the NIC on your own, which must be inside the /64 IPv6 CIDR block of the LAN and unique.

ipv6Ips.description: [list] Collection of IPv6 addresses assigned to a NIC. Explicitly assigned public IPs need to come from the NIC's Ipv6 CIDR block, Passing value null or empty array will assign an IPv6 address automatically from the NIC's CIDR block.

lan.description: [integer] The LAN ID the NIC will sit on.

mac.description: The MAC address of the NIC.

name.description: [string] The name of the LAN.

pciSlot.description: The PCI slot number of the Nic.

ionoscloud:compute/server:Server.description:
## Import

Resource Server can be imported using the `resource id` and the `datacenter id`, e.g.. Passing only resource id and datacenter id means that the first nic found linked to the server will be attached to it.

```sh
$ pulumi import ionoscloud:compute/server:Server myserver {datacenter uuid}/{server uuid}
```

Optionally, you can pass `primary_nic` and `firewallrule_id` so terraform will know to import also the first nic and firewall rule (if it exists on the server):

```sh
$ pulumi import ionoscloud:compute/server:Server myserver {datacenter uuid}/{server uuid}/{primary nic id}/{firewall rule id}
```

availabilityZone.description: [string] The availability zone in which the server should exist. E.g: `AUTO`, `ZONE_1`, `ZONE_2`. This property is immutable.

bootCdrom.description: ***DEPRECATED*** Please refer to ionoscloud.ServerBootDeviceSelection (Optional)(Computed)[string] The associated boot drive, if any. Must be the UUID of a bootable CDROM image that can be retrieved using the ionoscloud.getImage data source.
bootCdrom.deprecationMessage: Please use the 'ionoscloud_server_boot_device_selection' resource for managing the boot device of the server.

bootImage.description: [string] The image or snapshot UUID / name. May also be an image alias. It is required if `licence_type` is not provided.

cores.description: (Computed)[integer] Number of server CPU cores.

cpuFamily.description: [string] CPU architecture on which server gets provisioned; not all CPU architectures are available in all datacenter regions; available CPU architectures can be retrieved from the datacenter resource. E.g.: "INTEL_SKYLAKE" or "INTEL_XEON".

datacenterId.description: [string] The ID of a Virtual Data Center.

imageName.description: [string] The name, ID or alias of the image. May also be a snapshot ID. It is required if `licence_type` is not provided. Attribute is immutable.

inlineVolumeIds.description:
A list with the IDs for the volumes that are defined inside the server resource.

> **⚠ WARNING**
>
> Image_name under volume level is deprecated, please use image_name under server level
> ssh_key_path and ssh_keys fields are immutable.


> **⚠ WARNING**
>
> If you want to create a **CUBE** server, you have to provide the `template_uuid`. In this case you can not set `cores`, `ram` and `volume.size` arguments, these being mutually exclusive with `template_uuid`.
>
> In all the other cases (**ENTERPRISE** servers) you have to provide values for `cores`, `ram` and `volume size`.

labels.description: [set] A label can be seen as an object with only two required fields: `key` and `value`, both of the `string` type. Please check the example presented above to see how a `label` can be used in the plan. A server can have multiple labels.

name.description: [string] The name of the server.

ram.description: (Computed)[integer] The amount of memory for the server in MB.

sshKeyPaths.description: [list] List of absolute paths to files containing a public SSH key that will be injected into IonosCloud provided Linux images.  Also accepts ssh keys directly. Required for IonosCloud Linux images. Required if `image_password` is not provided. Does not support `~` expansion to homedir in the given path. This property is immutable.
sshKeyPaths.deprecationMessage: Will be renamed to ssh_keys in the future, to allow users to set both the ssh key path or directly the ssh key

sshKeys.description: [list] Immutable List of absolute or relative paths to files containing public SSH key that will be injected into IonosCloud provided Linux images. Also accepts ssh keys directly. Public SSH keys are set on the image as authorized keys for appropriate SSH login to the instance using the corresponding private key. This field may only be set in creation requests. When reading, it always returns null. SSH keys are only supported if a public Linux image is used for the volume creation. Does not support `~` expansion to homedir in the given path.

templateUuid.description: [string] The UUID of the template for creating a CUBE server; the available templates for CUBE servers can be found on the templates resource

type.description: (Computed)[string] Server usages: [ENTERPRISE](https://docs.ionos.com/cloud/compute-engine/virtual-servers/virtual-servers) or [CUBE](https://docs.ionos.com/cloud/compute-engine/virtual-servers/cloud-cubes). This property is immutable.

vmState.description: [string] Sets the power state of the server. E.g: `RUNNING`, `SHUTOFF` or `SUSPENDED`. SUSPENDED state is only valid for cube. SHUTOFF state is only valid for enterprise.

availabilityZone.description: [string] The availability zone in which the server should exist. E.g: `AUTO`, `ZONE_1`, `ZONE_2`. This property is immutable.

availabilityZone.description: [string] The availability zone of the virtual datacenter region where the node pool resources should be provisioned. Must be set with one of the values `AUTO`, `ZONE_1` or `ZONE_2`. The default value is `AUTO`.

clusterId.description: [string] The UUID of an existing Dataplatform cluster.

coresCount.description: [int] The number of CPU cores per node. Must be set with a minimum value of 1. The default value is `4`.

cpuFamily.description: [string] A valid CPU family name or `AUTO` if the platform shall choose the best fitting option. Available CPU architectures can be retrieved from the datacenter resource. The default value is `AUTO`.

datacenterId.description: The UUID of the virtual data center (VDC) in which the nodepool is provisioned

labels.description: [map] Key-value pairs attached to the node pool resource as [Kubernetes labels](https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/labels/).

maintenanceWindows.description: [string] Starting time of a weekly 4 hour-long window, during which maintenance might occur in hh:mm:ss format

name.description: [string] The name of your node pool. Must be 63 characters or less and must be empty or begin and end with an alphanumeric character ([a-z0-9A-Z]). It can contain dashes (-), underscores (_), dots (.), and alphanumerics in-between.

nodeCount.description: [int] The number of nodes that make up the node pool. Must be set with a minimum value of 1.

ramSize.description: [int] The RAM size for one node in MB. Must be set in multiples of `1024`MB, with a minimum size is of `2048`MB. The default value is `4096`.

storageSize.description: [int] The size of the volume in GB. The size must be greater than `10`GB. The default value is `20`.

storageType.description: [int] The type of hardware for the volume. Must be set with one of the values `HDD` or `SSD`. The default value is `SSD`.

version.description: The version of the Data Platform.

clusterId.description: The ID of the Kafka Cluster to which the topic belongs.

location.description: The location of your Kafka Cluster Topic. Supported locations: de/fra, de/txl

name.description:
The name of your Kafka Cluster Topic. Must be 63 characters or less and must begin and end with an alphanumeric
character (`[a-z0-9A-Z]`) with dashes (`-`), underscores (`_`), dots (`.`), and alphanumerics between.

numberOfPartitions.description:
The number of partitions of the topic. Partitions allow for parallel processing of messages. The partition count must be
greater than or equal to the replication factor.

replicationFactor.description:
The number of replicas of the topic. The replication factor determines how many copies of the topic are stored on
different brokers. The replication factor must be less than or equal to the number of brokers in the Kafka Cluster.

retentionTime.description:
This configuration controls the maximum time we will retain a log before we will discard old log segments to free up
space. This represents an SLA on how soon consumers must read their data. If set to -1, no time limit is applied.

segmentBytes.description:
This configuration controls the segment file size for the log. Retention and cleaning is always done a file at a time so
a larger segment size means fewer files but less granular control over retention.

bootDeviceId.description:
[string] The ID of a bootable device such as a volume or an image data source. If this field is omitted from the configuration, the VM will be restarted with no primary boot device, and it will enter the PXE shell for network booting. 
***Note***: If the network booting process started by the PXE shell fails, the VM will still boot into the image of the attached storage as a fallback. This behavior imitates the "Boot from Network" option from [DCD](https://dcd.ionos.com/).

defaultBootVolumeId.description: ID of the first attached volume of the Server, which will be the default boot volume.

sharePrivilege.description:
[Boolean] The group has permission to share this resource.

⚠️ **Note:** There is a limitation due to which the creation of several shares at the same time leads
to an error. To avoid this, `parallelism=1` can be used when running `pulumi up` command in order
to create the resources in a sequential manner. Another solution involves the usage of `depends_on`
attributes inside the `ionoscloud.Share` resource to enforce the sequential creation of the shares.

ionoscloud:index/vcpuServer:VcpuServer.description:
## Import

Resource VCPU Server can be imported using the `resource id` and the `datacenter id`, for example, passing only resource id and datacenter id means that the first nic found linked to the server will be attached to it.

```sh
$ pulumi import ionoscloud:index/vcpuServer:VcpuServer myserver {datacenter uuid}/{server uuid}
```

Optionally, you can pass `primary_nic` and `firewallrule_id` so terraform will know to import also the first nic and firewall rule (if it exists on the server):

```sh
$ pulumi import ionoscloud:index/vcpuServer:VcpuServer myserver {datacenter uuid}/{server uuid}/{primary nic id}/{firewall rule id}
```

bootCdrom.deprecationMessage: Please use the 'ionoscloud_server_boot_device_selection' resource for managing the boot device of the server.

Also accepts ssh keys directly. Public SSH keys are set on the image as authorized keys for appropriate SSH login to the instance using the corresponding private key. This field may only be set in creation requests. When reading, it always returns null. SSH keys are only supported if a public Linux image is used for the volume creation. Does not support `~` expansion to homedir in the given path.

ionoscloud:index/getApigatewayRoute:getA.description:
The **API Gateway Route data source** can be used to search for and return an existing API Gateway route.
You can provide a string for the name parameter which will be compared with provisioned API Gateway routes.
If a single match is found, it will be returned. If your search results in multiple matches, an error will be returned.
When this happens, please refine your search string so that it is specific enough to return only one result.

## Example Usage

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getApigatewayRoute.

gatewayId.description: The ID of the API Gateway that the route belongs to.

id.description: ID of an existing API Gateway Route that you want to search for.

name.description: Name of an existing API Gateway Route that you want to search for.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getApigatewayRoute.

id.description: ID of the API Gateway Route.

methods.description: The HTTP methods that the route should match.

name.description: The name of the API Gateway Route.

paths.description: The paths that the route should match.

type.description: This field specifies the protocol used by the ingress to route traffic to the backend service.

websocket.description: Shows whether websocket support is enabled or disabled.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getApplicationLoadbalancer.

partialMatch.description:
Whether partial matching is allowed or not when using name argument. Default value is false.

`datacenter_id` and either `name` or `id` must be provided. If none, or both of `name` and `id` are provided, the datasource will return an error.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getApplicationLoadbalancer.

centralLogging.description: Turn logging on and off for this product. Default value is 'false'.

flowlogs.description: Only 1 flow log can be configured. Only the name field can change as part of an update. Flow logs holistically capture network information such as source and destination IP addresses, source and destination ports, number of packets, amount of bytes, the start and end time of the recording, and the type of protocol – and log the extent to which your instances are being accessed.

id.description: Id of the application load balancer.

ips.description: Collection of the Application Load Balancer IP addresses. (Inbound and outbound) IPs of the listenerLan are customer-reserved public IPs for the public Load Balancers, and private IPs for the private Load Balancers.

lbPrivateIps.description: Collection of private IP addresses with the subnet mask of the Application Load Balancer. IPs must contain valid a subnet mask. If no IP is provided, the system will generate an IP with /24 subnet.

name.description: Specifies the name of the flow log.

targetLan.description: ID of the balanced private target LAN (outbound).

ionoscloud:index/getCubeServer:getCubeSe.description:
The **Cube Server data source** can be used to search for and return existing servers. 
If a single match is found, it will be returned. If your search results in multiple matches, an error will be returned.
When this happens, please refine your search string so that it is specific enough to return only one result.

## Example Usage

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getCubeServer.

datacenterId.description: Datacenter's UUID.

id.description:
ID of the server you want to search for.

`datacenter_id` and either `name` or `id` must be provided. If none, or both of `name` and `id` are provided, the datasource will return an error.

name.description: Name of an existing server that you want to search for.

templateUuid.description: The UUID of the template for creating a CUBE server; the available templates for CUBE servers can be found on the templates resource

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getCubeServer.

availabilityZone.description: The availability zone in which the volume should exist

datacenterId.description: The id of the datacenter

id.description: Id of the firewall rule

name.description: Name of the firewall rule

templateUuid.description: The UUID of the template for creating a CUBE server; the available templates for CUBE servers can be found on the templates resource

location.description:
Id of the existing Virtual Data Center's location.

Either `name`, `location` or `id` must be provided. If none, the datasource will return an error.

name.description: Name of an existing Virtual Data Center that you want to search for.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getDatacenter.

cpuArchitectures.description: Array of features and CPU families available in a location

description.description: Description for the Virtual Data Center

features.description: List of features supported by the location this data center is part of

id.description: UUID of the Virtual Data Center

location.description: The regional location where the Virtual Data Center will be created

name.description: The name of the Virtual Data Center

secAuthProtection.description: Boolean value representing if the data center requires extra protection e.g. two factor protection

version.description: The version of that Data Center. Gets incremented with every change

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getDataplatformCluster.

id.description: ID of the cluster you want to search for.

name.description: Name of an existing cluster that you want to search for. Search by name is case-insensitive. The whole resource name is required if `partial_match` parameter is not set to true.

partialMatch.description:
Whether partial matching is allowed or not when using name argument. Default value is false.

Either `id` or `name` must be provided. If none, or both are provided, the datasource will return an error.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getDataplatformCluster.

caCrt.description: base64 decoded cluster certificate authority data (provided as an attribute for direct use)

configs.description:
structured kubernetes config consisting of a list with 1 item with the following fields:
* api_version - Kubernetes API Version
* kind - "Config"
* current-context - string
* clusters - list of
* name - name of cluster
* cluster - map of
* certificate-authority-data - **base64 decoded** cluster CA data
* server -  server address in the form `https://host:port`
* contexts - list of
* name - context name
* context - map of
* cluster - cluster name
* user - cluster user
* users - list of
* name - user name
* user - map of
* token - user token used for authentication

datacenterId.description: The UUID of the virtual data center (VDC) in which the cluster is provisioned.

id.description: The UUID of the cluster.

lans.description: A list of LANs you want this node pool to be part of

maintenanceWindows.description: Starting time of a weekly 4 hour-long window, during which maintenance might occur in hh:mm:ss format

name.description: The name of your cluster.

server.description: cluster server (same as `config[0].clusters[0].cluster.server` but provided as an attribute for ease of use)

userTokens.description:
a convenience map to be search the token of a specific user
* key - is the user name
* value - is the token

version.description: The version of the Data Platform.

ionoscloud:index/getDataplatformNodePool.description:
The **Dataplatform Node Pool Data Source** can be used to search for and return an existing Dataplatform Node Pool under a Dataplatform Cluster.
If a single match is found, it will be returned. If your search results in multiple matches, an error will be returned.
When this happens, please refine your search and make sure that your resources have unique names.

## Example Usage

clusterId.description: ID of the cluster the searched node pool is part of.

id.description: ID of the node pool you want to search for.

name.description: Name of an existing cluster that you want to search for. Search by name is case-insensitive. The whole resource name is required if `partial_match` parameter is not set to true.

partialMatch.description:
Whether partial matching is allowed or not when using name argument. Default value is false.

Either `id` or `name` must be provided. If none, or both are provided, the datasource will return an error.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getDataplatformNodePool.

annotations.description: Key-value pairs attached to node pool resource as [Kubernetes annotations](https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/annotations/).

availabilityZone.description: The availability zone of the virtual datacenter region where the node pool resources should be provisioned.

clusterId.description: ID of the cluster the searched node pool is part of.

coresCount.description: The number of CPU cores per node.

datacenterId.description: The UUID of the virtual data center (VDC) the cluster is provisioned.

id.description: ID of your node pool.

labels.description: Key-value pairs attached to the node pool resource as [Kubernetes labels](https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/labels/).

maintenanceWindows.description: Starting time of a weekly 4 hour-long window, during which maintenance might occur in hh:mm:ss format

name.description: The name of your node pool

nodeCount.description: The number of nodes that make up the node pool.

ramSize.description: The RAM size for one node in MB.

storageSize.description: The size of the volume in GB.

storageType.description: The type of hardware for the volume.

version.description: The version of the Data Platform.

ionoscloud:index/getDnsRecord:getDnsReco.description:
The **DNS Record** can be used to search for and return an existing DNS Record.
If a single match is found, it will be returned. If your search results in multiple matches, an error will be returned.
When this happens, please refine your search and make sure that your resources have unique names.

> ⚠️  Only tokens are accepted for authorization in the **ionoscloud_dns_record** data source. Please ensure you are using tokens as other methods will not be valid.

## Example Usage

name.description: [string] The name of the DNS Record you want to search for.

partialMatch.description:
[bool] Whether partial matching is allowed or not when using name argument. Default value is false.

Either `id` or `name` must be provided. If none, or both are provided, the datasource will return an error.

zoneId.description: [string] The ID of the DNS Zone in which the DNS Record can be found.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getDnsRecord.

content.description: The content of the DNS Record.

enabled.description: Indicates if the DNS Record is active or not.

id.description: The UUID of the DNS Record.

name.description: The name of the DNS Record.

priority.description: The priority for the DNS Record.

ttl.description: The time to live of the DNS Record.

type.description: The type of the DNS Record.

[bool] Whether partial matching is allowed or not when using name argument. Default value is false.

Either `id` or `name` must be provided. If none, or both are provided, the datasource will return an error.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getDnsZone.

description.description: The description of the DNS Zone.

enabled.description: Indicates if the DNS Zone is activated or not.

id.description: The UUID of the DNS Zone.

name.description: The name of the DNS Zone.

nameservers.description: A list of available name servers.

ionoscloud:index/getFirewall:getFirewall.description:
The **Firewall data source** can be used to search for and return an existing FirewallRules. 
You can provide a string for either id or name parameters which will be compared with provisioned Firewall Rules.
If a single match is found, it will be returned. If your search results in multiple matches, an error will be returned. 
When this happens, please refine your search string so that it is specific enough to return only one result.

## Example Usage

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getFirewall.

datacenterId.description: The Virtual Data Center ID.

id.description: ID of the firewall rule you want to search for.

name.description: Name of an existing firewall rule that you want to search for.

nicId.description:
The NIC ID.

Either `name` or   `id` must be provided. If none, or both are provided, the datasource will return an error.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getFirewall.

icmpCode.description: Defines the allowed code (from 0 to 254) if protocol ICMP is chosen.

icmpType.description: Defines the allowed type (from 0 to 254) if the protocol ICMP is chosen.

id.description: The id of the firewall rule.

name.description: The name of the firewall rule.

portRangeEnd.description: Defines the end range of the allowed port (from 1 to 65534) if the protocol TCP or UDP is chosen.

portRangeStart.description: Defines the start range of the allowed port (from 1 to 65534) if protocol TCP or UDP is chosen.

protocol.description: The protocol for the rule: TCP, UDP, ICMP, ANY. This property is immutable.

sourceIp.description: Only traffic originating from the respective IPv4 address is allowed.

sourceMac.description: Only traffic originating from the respective MAC address is allowed.

targetIp.description: Only traffic directed to the respective IP address of the NIC is allowed.

configs.description:
structured kubernetes config consisting of a list with 1 item with the following fields:
* api_version - Kubernetes API Version
* kind - "Config"
* current-context - string
* clusters - list of
* name - name of cluster
* cluster - map of
* certificate-authority-data - **base64 decoded** cluster CA data
* server -  server address in the form `https://host:port`
* contexts - list of
* name - context name
* context - map of
* cluster - cluster name
* user - cluster user
* users - list of
* name - user name
* user - map of
* token - user token used for authentication

id.description: id of the cluster

location.description: this attribute is mandatory if the cluster is private.

maintenanceWindows.description: A maintenance window comprise of a day of the week and a time for maintenance to be allowed

name.description: name of the cluster

nodePools.description: list of the IDs of the node pools in this cluster

nodeSubnet.description: the node subnet of the cluster, if the cluster is private.

public.description: indicates if the cluster is public or private.

s3Buckets.description: list of IONOS Object Storage bucket configured for K8s usage

server.description: cluster server (same as `config[0].clusters[0].cluster.server` but provided as an attribute for ease of use)

userTokens.description:
a convenience map to be search the token of a specific user
- key - is the user name
- value - is the token

viableNodePoolVersions.description: A list of versions that may be used for node pools under this cluster

size.description: The size of the image in GB

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getTargetGroup.

id.description: ID of the target group you want to search for.

name.description: Name of an existing target group that you want to search for. Search by name is case-insensitive. The whole resource name is required if `partial_match` parameter is not set to true.

partialMatch.description:
Whether partial matching is allowed or not when using name argument. Default value is false.

Either `name` or `id` must be provided. If none, or both of `name` and `id` are provided, the datasource will return an error.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getTargetGroup.

healthChecks.description: Health check attributes for Target Group.

httpHealthChecks.description: Http health check attributes for Target Group

id.description: The Id of that Target group

name.description: The name of that Target Group.

protocolVersion.description: The forwarding protocol version. Value is ignored when protocol is not 'HTTP'.

targets.description: Array of items in the collection

storageSize.description:
The storage size in GB.

Any of the arguments ca be provided. If none, the datasource will return an error.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getTemplate.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getUser.

email.description: Email of an existing user that you want to search for.

id.description:
ID of the user you want to search for.

Either `email` or `id` can be provided. If no argument is set, the provider will search for the **email that was provided for the configuration**. If none is found, the provider will return an error.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getUser.

active.description: Indicates if the user is active

administrator.description: Indicates if the user has administrative rights. Administrators do not need to be managed in groups, as they automatically have access to all resources associated with the contract.

email.description: The e-mail address for the user.

firstName.description: The first name for the user.

forceSecAuth.description: Indicates if secure (two-factor) authentication should be forced for the user (true) or not (false).

groups.description: Shows the id and name of the groups that the user is a member of

id.description: The id of the user.

lastName.description: The last name for the user.

s3CanonicalUserId.description: Canonical (S3) id of the user for a given identity

secAuthActive.description: Indicates if secure authentication is active for the user or not

ionoscloud:index/getVcpuServer:getVcpuSe.description:
The **VCPU Server data source** can be used to search for and return existing VCPU servers. 
If a single match is found, it will be returned. If your search results in multiple matches, an error will be returned.
When this happens, please refine your search string so that it is specific enough to return only one result.

## Example Usage

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getVcpuServer.

datacenterId.description: Datacenter's UUID.

id.description:
ID of the server you want to search for.

`datacenter_id` and either `name` or `id` must be provided. If none, or both of `name` and `id` are provided, the datasource will return an error.

name.description: Name of an existing server that you want to search for.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getVcpuServer.

availabilityZone.description: The availability zone in which the volume should exist

cores.description: The total number of cores for the server

cpuFamily.description: CPU architecture on which server gets provisioned; not all CPU architectures are available in all datacenter regions; available CPU architectures can be retrieved from the datacenter resource.

datacenterId.description: The id of the datacenter

id.description: The Id of the label

name.description: Name of the firewall rule

ram.description: The amount of memory for the server in MB

type.description: The type of firewall rule

ionoscloud:index/getVolume:getVolume.description:
The volume data source can be used to search for and return existing volumes.
If a single match is found, it will be returned. If your search results in multiple matches, an error will be returned.
When this happens, please refine your search string so that it is specific enough to return only one result.

## Example Usage

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getVolume.

id.description:
ID of the volume you want to search for.

Either `volume` or `id` must be provided. If none, or both are provided, the datasource will return an error.

name.description: Name of an existing volume that you want to search for.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getVolume.

availabilityZone.description: The storage availability zone assigned to the volume: AUTO, ZONE_1, ZONE_2, or ZONE_3. This property is immutable.

backupUnitId.description: The uuid of the Backup Unit that user has access to. The property is immutable and is only allowed to be set on a new volume creation. It is mandatory to provide either 'public image' or 'imageAlias' in conjunction with this property.

bootServer.description: The UUID of the attached server.

bus.description: The bus type of the volume: VIRTIO or IDE.

cpuHotPlug.description: Is capable of CPU hot plug (no reboot required)

deviceNumber.description: The LUN ID of the storage volume. Null for volumes not mounted to any VM

discVirtioHotPlug.description: Is capable of Virt-IO drive hot plug (no reboot required)

discVirtioHotUnplug.description: Is capable of Virt-IO drive hot unplug (no reboot required). This works only for non-Windows virtual Machines.

diskType.description: The volume type: HDD or SSD.

id.description: The id of the volume.

name.description: The name of the volume.

nicHotPlug.description: Is capable of nic hot plug (no reboot required)

nicHotUnplug.description: Is capable of nic hot unplug (no reboot required)

ramHotPlug.description: Is capable of memory hot plug (no reboot required)

size.description: The size of the volume in GB.

userData.description: The cloud-init configuration for the volume as base64 encoded string. The property is immutable and is only allowed to be set on a new volume creation. This option will work only with cloud-init compatible images.

ionoscloud:index/getVpnIpsecGateway:getV.description:
The **VPN IPSec Gateway data source** can be used to search for and return an existing IPSec Gateway.
You can provide a string for the name parameter which will be compared with provisioned IPSec Gateways.
If a single match is found, it will be returned. If your search results in multiple matches, an error will be returned.
When this happens, please refine your search string so that it is specific enough to return only one result.

## Example Usage

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getVpnIpsecGateway.

id.description: ID of an existing IPSec Gateway that you want to search for.

location.description: The location of the IPSec Gateway.

name.description: Name of an existing IPSec Gateway that you want to search for.

version.description: The IKE version that is permitted for the VPN tunnels.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getVpnIpsecGateway.

connections.description: The network connection for your gateway.

description.description: (Optional)[string] The human-readable description of the IPSec Gateway.

gatewayIp.description: Public IP address to be assigned to the gateway.

id.description: The unique ID of the IPSec Gateway.

name.description: The name of the IPSec Gateway.

version.description: The IKE version that is permitted for the VPN tunnels.

ionoscloud:index/getVpnIpsecTunnel:getVp.description:
The **VPN IPSec Gateway Tunnel data source** can be used to search for and return an existing IPSec Gateway Tunnel.
You can provide a string for the name parameter which will be compared with provisioned IPSec Gateway Tunnels.
If a single match is found, it will be returned. If your search results in multiple matches, an error will be returned.
When this happens, please refine your search string so that it is specific enough to return only one result.

## Example Usage

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getVpnIpsecTunnel.

gatewayId.description: The ID of the IPSec Gateway that the tunnel belongs to.

id.description: ID of an existing IPSec Gateway Tunnel that you want to search for.

location.description: The location of the IPSec Gateway Tunnel.

name.description: Name of an existing IPSec Gateway Tunnel that you want to search for.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getVpnIpsecTunnel.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getVpnWireguardGateway.

description.description: The description of the WireGuard Gateway.

id.description: [String] The ID of the WireGuard Gateway.

location.description: [String] The location of the WireGuard Gateway.

name.description: [String] The name of the WireGuard Gateway.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getVpnWireguardGateway.

connections.description: A list of connection configurations for the WireGuard Gateway. Each `connections` block contains:

description.description: The description of the WireGuard Gateway.

gatewayIp.description: The IP address of the WireGuard Gateway.

interfaceIpv4Cidr.description: The IPv4 CIDR for the WireGuard Gateway interface.

interfaceIpv6Cidr.description: The IPv6 CIDR for the WireGuard Gateway interface.

publicKey.description: The public key for the WireGuard Gateway.

status.description: The current status of the WireGuard Gateway.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getVpnWireguardPeer.

gatewayId.description: [String] The ID of the WireGuard Gateway.

id.description: [String] The ID of the WireGuard Peer.

location.description: [String] The location of the WireGuard Gateway.

name.description: [String] The name of the WireGuard Peer.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getVpnWireguardPeer.

allowedIps.description: The subnet CIDRs that are allowed to connect to the WireGuard Gateway.

description.description: The description of the WireGuard Peer.

endpoints.description: The endpoint of the WireGuard Peer.

id.description: The unique ID of the WireGuard Peer.

name.description: The name of the WireGuard Peer.

publicKey.description: WireGuard public key of the connecting peer.

status.description: The current status of the WireGuard Peer.
